Instruction: Combine rice and water in a saucepan, then bring the mixture to a boil. Lower the heat, cover, and let it simmer for 20 minutes.

At the same time, add the chicken breast halves to a large saucepan and cover them with water. Bring the water to a boil and cook for 20 minutes, or until fully cooked. Take the chicken out of the water. Once it has cooled enough to handle, cut the meat into bite-sized pieces.
Set the oven to preheat at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and gently grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.

In a medium bowl, blend Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses. In another bowl, combine cream of chicken soup, cream of mushroom soup, onion, and salsa. Arrange 1/2 of the rice, 1/2 of the chicken, 1/2 of the soup and salsa mixture, and 1/2 of the cheese mixture in the prepared dish. Repeat the layers, finishing with the cheese on top.
Place in the preheated oven and bake for approximately 40 minutes, or until it is bubbly.
